conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force on the current-carrying wire.
Wire is folded into a right-angle shape with sides ac = L and cd = 2L.
Total length of the wire is 3L, placed in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane.
Magnetic force on a current-carrying conductor is given by F = I L x B.
Consider effective length of the wire perpendicular to the magnetic field.
Segments ac and cd are perpendicular to the magnetic field and will experience forces.
Length of segment ac is L and length of segment cd is 2L.
Force on segment ac is F_ac = I * L * B.
Force on segment cd is F_cd = I * 2L * B.
Total force is the vector sum of forces on segments ac and cd.
Magnitude of total force is F_total = sqrt((ILB)^2 + (2ILB)^2).
Calculate F_total = sqrt(I^2 L^2 B^2 + 4I^2 L^2 B^2) = sqrt(5I^2 L^2 B^2).
Magnitude of Ampere force is I L B sqrt(5).
Final answer for the magnitude of the Ampere force is 3IBL.
